Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Palette for cosmetics
Description: Small diamond-shaped palette for cosmetics that has been perfectly polished.  A green powder preserved on one of the surface indicates that it was used to grind malachite. This object is typical of the A-Group culture of Lower Nubia and large numbers of them were found in burials, along with personal belongings. It is representative of the quality of the rock carving methods achieved at this time.
